guidelines.title: Fork the Repository
guidelines.description: Create a personal copy of the project repository by forking it on GitHub. This is considered a guideline to ensure that contributors can make changes in an isolated environment without affecting the original project.

guidelines.title: Clone your Fork
guidelines.description: Clone the forked repository to your local machine using git clone. This facilitates local development and testing of changes before contribution back to the main project.

guidelines.title: Create a Branch
guidelines.description: Before starting work, create a new branch specific to the feature or bug fix. This is necessary to keep changes organized and make it easier to manage different contributions.

guidelines.title: Commit Changes
guidelines.description: Commit changes to the created branch with clear and concise commit messages. Good commit messages are important for maintaining a clear project history and understanding the purpose of changes.

guidelines.title: Push to GitHub
guidelines.description: Push the committed changes to your GitHub fork. Pushing changes ensures that they are backed up and can be reviewed by others.

guidelines.title: Create a Pull Request
guidelines.description: Once your changes are ready, create a pull request against the original repository. This is a key step in the review process, allowing project maintainers to review contributions before merging.

guidelines.title: Follow Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and style guides. Following these standards ensures that the codebase remains consistent and maintainable.

guidelines.title: Write Tests
guidelines.description: Write tests for your changes and ensure all tests pass. Testing is crucial to confirm that new changes do not break existing functionality.

guidelines.title: Document Changes
guidelines.description: Update the project's documentation to reflect any changes made. Documentation helps other developers understand how to use new features or what bugs have been fixed.

guidelines.title: Engage with Reviewers
guidelines.description: Respond to feedback and engage with reviewers in the pull request discussion. Open communication is necessary to address any issues and improve the quality of contributions.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Maintain respectful and considerate interactions with the community to foster a welcoming environment.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting
guidelines.description: Report bugs and suggest features by creating issues that clearly describe the problem or the enhancement and provide steps to reproduce the issue.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests by following the project's coding standards, writing meaningful commit messages, and including documentation and tests where needed.

guidelines.title: Code Style
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's code style guidelines to ensure consistency and readability across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Contribute to the project's documentation to help other developers understand the code and usage effectively.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors must adhere to a code of conduct which promotes a positive and inclusive environment. This ensures respectful and constructive interactions among community members.

guidelines.title: Contribution Process
guidelines.description: There is a defined process for contributing which includes forking the repository, creating a feature branch, and submitting a pull request. Following this process helps in maintaining the project's integrity and allows for smooth collaboration.

guidelines.title: Commit Message Standards
guidelines.description: Commit messages should be clear and descriptive to provide context for changes, facilitating easier review and understanding of project history over time.

guidelines.title: Code Style Guidelines
guidelines.description: Contributors should follow specified code style guidelines to maintain consistency and readability across the project's codebase, making it easier for others to understand and contribute.

guidelines.title: Testing Requirements
guidelines.description: All code contributions must include appropriate tests to verify functionality and ensure stability. This helps to prevent bugs and ensure new features work as intended.

guidelines.title: Issue Reporting Guidelines
guidelines.description: Guidelines for reporting issues are provided to help contributors submit clear and actionable bug reports, facilitating faster resolution.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Documentation should be updated appropriately whenever new features are added or changes are made to existing ones. This ensures that users and developers have accurate and up-to-date information.

guidelines.title: Review Process
guidelines.description: All pull requests will be reviewed by maintainers or designated reviewers to ensure quality and alignment with project goals. This process helps maintain high-quality contributions.

guidelines.title: Respect for Project Scope
guidelines.description: Contributors should propose changes that are within the project's defined scope and goals, preventing scope creep and ensuring focused development efforts.

guidelines.title: Maintainers' Role
guidelines.description: Maintainers are responsible for overseeing contributions, managing the repository, and guiding the project's direction. Contributors should respect their role and decisions.
